availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: Henry Connolley (Louisville, Jefferson County, Kentucky, plasterer)

body.p: Louisville, Kentucky, boarding house keeper. Maryland native. Married to Madaline Beingraf Connolley in Louisville, Kentucky, in November 1862. Boardinghouse keeper in Louisville, Kentucky, in 1850. Owned four enslaved persons in Jefferson County in 1850. Boardinghouse keeper in Louisville in 1860. Owned seven enslaved persons in Jefferson County in 1860. Proprietor of the Virginia House in Louisville in 1865.

Kentucky Marriage Records, Madison County Courthouse, Richmond, Kentucky, Jefferson County Marriages, Film 000819615.
